title: Castoro Cellars 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Dark berry fruit, loamy soil and dense purple flowers make for a pure straightforward nose on this bottling from the longtime producer. The palate shows pleasant flavors of black currant and black cherry with hints of vanilla and anise-laced biscotti. The tannins are chalky, tough nearly chunky, and will smooth with time.

title: Château de Gironville 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: From a small vineyard in the southern Médoc, this wine is rich and structured. It has had 12 months in wood, which shows in its spicy, toasty character. This is balanced by the ripe black-currant fruits that are developing well. Drink from 2024

title: Château la France Delhomme 2015  Médoc
description: This Bouey estate, with its historic 18th-century tower, is named for an ancestor. This wine is richly endowed, structured and with a solid core of tannins. The black-currant fruit around the tannins is balanced, ripe and likely to age along with the wood and tannic structure. Drink from 2021.

title: Château la Gravette Lacombe 2015  Médoc
description: This wine, a blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon with Merlot and Petit Verdot, is ripe and full of black fruits. The tannins and wood aging are well integrated into the rich mélange of berries and acidity. Worth aging, the wine will be good to drink from 2023.

title: Château Labadie 2015  Médoc
description: With a high percentage of Merlot, this is a ripe, juicy and red-fruit-flavored wine. It is soft, with the tannins already well integrated into the plush fruit. This rich, generous wine will be ready to drink from 2022.

title: Baron De Ley 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe, earthy plum and cassis aromas are slightly smoky, with a graphite note. An oaky palate is spread a bit thin, while flavors of red currant and plum are backed by dry oak that extends onto the finish. Drink now.

title: Belondrade 2015 Belondrade y Lurton Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A gold color and wheaty aromas of straw and haystack are devoid of Verdejo's patented high-toned aromas. A soft palate is low on acidity, while this tastes woody, with hard-to-find white-fruit flavors. A peachy, leesy finish shows residual oak. Enjoy soon.

title: Bindella 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Aromas of red and black-skinned berry align with whiffs of dark culinary spice. Reflecting the nose, the light-bodied, almost ethereal palate offers red cherry, strawberry, orange zest and star anise set against bright acidity and slightly dusty tannins.

title: Cardwell Hill 2014 Estate Bottled Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a fruity mix of maraschino cherries, candied citrus, chocolate and cinnamon spice. It's a dry wine, yet tastes a bit like dessert in a bottle. Full, round and forward, it showcases the house style, which is immediate, delicious, forward, spicy and loaded with candied fruit.

title: Château Brondelle 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Crisp herbal and lemon flavors are balanced by ripe tropical-fruit tones. It's a refreshing, lively and fruity wine that will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Le Nardian 2017 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Kiwi, tropical fruit and intense citrus flavors give this wine a rich and full impression. It has a floral character, which provides a fragrant lift.

title: Fernández Gómez 2016 Selección Familia White (Rioja)
description: One sniff announces that this Viura-Malvasia-Garnacha Blanca blend is fully oaked, while good acidity cuts some of the wine's resiny weight. While barrel-based flavors are firmly in charge, this offers apple and stone-fruit notes prior to a finish that tastes slightly buttery.

title: Concura 2013 Riserva  (Primitivo di Manduria)
description: There's a pleasing richness to this wine in its aromas of ripe dark cherry, blackberry and tobacco leaf. The palate brings oak tones that are well-integrated with the juicy dark fruit flavors, the medium-grained, grippy tannins and vibrant acidity offer solid support.

title: Dalton 2016 Estate Unoaked Pinot Gris (Galilee)
description: With a nose of melon and almond blossom, this wine offers flavors of green apple, pear and lemon, with soft floral notes. It is bright on the palate yet soft in the mouth, with a citrus finish that is marked by a touch of bitter almond.

title: Domaine Charles Frey 2016 Blettig Sylvaner (Alsace)
description: A ripe notion of yellow pear joins hints of pithy citrus on the nose. The palate represies the notion of very ripe, juicy, yellow pear and the pithy, textural element of citrus. The palate is light and dry but full of fruit. The finish is clean and fresh.

title: Château Broustet 2017 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Rich in flavors of toffee and spice, this is already soft and smooth. It does seem to miss out on acidity, which results in a fat texture. It is full, ripe and likely to develop quickly. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Haut-Carles 2017 Barrel Sample  (Fronsac)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Very firm, this wine has serious, dense tannins that are currently masking the fruit. An attractive perfumed character indicates the fruit will certainly develop with time. Drink from 2023.

title: Clos Lunelles 2017 Barrel Sample  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This wine is delicate and light, with plenty of attractive acidity and a bright character that is immediately approachable. It's a wine that will develop quickly, drink from 2021.

title: Château la Bessane 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This wine is light and gently fruity, with black currant flavors and a dry core that will develop well. It has spice, a juicy texture and a crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Lamothe-Cissac 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Crisp and full of black currant freshness, this wine has plenty of acidity. It also has ample tannic structure that will allow it to age. Drink this fruity, bright wine from 2022.

title: Château Lestage 2017 Barrel Sample  (Listrac-Médoc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Under the same ownership as Château Fonréaud, this wine is spicy and wood-laden. It has weight as well, giving promise for the future. With its dense texture and concentration, it will need time. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Couhins 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Soft and fruity, this is a generous wine that will develop quickly. It shows ripe red fruits and gentle tannins with wood flavors on the finish. Drink from 2022.

title: Chateau Dauzac 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Firm tannins give this wine its structure while also supporting some bitter extraction flavors. It's a tough wine at this stage, just hinting at black currant fruit, though it offers plenty of acidity. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Reysson 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This wine is bright in character, offering juicy black currant, lively acidity and a strong spice note. With this freshness, the wine will develop quickly and will be ready to drink from 2021.

title: Adegas Gran Vinum 2016 Selección Especial Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Melony aromas are leesy and a touch rich and flat. That's also how the palate comes across. Inexact nectarine flavors are plump and turn slightly bitter and yeasty on the finish. It's best to drink this right away.

title: Cantina del Giusto 2014 San Claudio II  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Aromas of chopped herb, wild berry and a whiff of cake spice float out of the glass. The taut bright palate offers red cherry, raspberry and hints of star anise set against vibrant acidity and polished tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Carpineto 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Aromas suggesting underbrush, oak, new leather and chopped herb come together in the glass. The austere palate offers dried cherry, dried sage and roasted coffee bean set against close-grained tannins that grip the finish.

title: Casteani 2013 Marujo  (Maremma Toscana)
description: Made entirely with Syrah vinified and aged in terracotta amphora, this opens with aromas of black currant, black pepper and a whiff of pine forest. The firm but easy-drinking palate offers mature blackberry, cooking spice and clove alongside velvety tannins.

title: Catman 2015 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Sporting a smooth, almost satiny mouthfeel, this high-octane Pinot brings a mouthful of brambly berries, with highlights of lightly peppery herbs. The tannins turn astringent, with a green-tea character. Best consumed over the next four or five years.

title: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2013 Clos du Zahnacker White (Alsace)
description: Heady rose petal notes are framed by lots of earthiness on the nose. The off-dry palate has the same contrast of heady perfume and earthy core on a very fluid, almost oily palate. The finish has a pleasantly bitter freshness.
